column4: saved the modules to be loaded on startup? and rebooted since?
yes i did and answer yes to all of the questions and save it after it finished scanning
yup, i rebooted. then installed sensors-applet from synaptics, added it to my panel. it can detect the CPU and GPU temp but not the fan anymore. it's really strange.

what do you mean by the output? are you referring to sensors-applet (GUI) in my panel? if yes, in the preferences part it shows 4 categories. libsensors, acpi, hddtemp, nvidia. thats all in 10.4 it also shows fan category
run "sensors" in a terminal...and paste the output on pastebin
run "sudo sensors-detect" once again the paste all the output on pastebin
here it is http://pastebin.com/0aYnshCK i'll just reboot again to see if anything changes brb. thanks bonjoyee
its not loading a driver for your super IO chip..thats the cause
thanks, so what should i do to make it load? is there a way?

yeah it did. but only for monitoring. anyways if it can't be done its ok. when i check the fan physically it is working but guess no monitoring for me in 10.10. anyways thanks bonjoyee for enlightening me.
as the last bet..you could add the module that worked in 10.04..to /etc/modules in 10.10..not sure it will work though!
yeah i think thats a good idea. i'll try that one a bit later and let u know.
